testcase.name: pkg:maven/log4j/log4j@1.2.17

skipped.message: Log4J SocketServer is not used, so not vulnerable

testcase.system-out: Improper validation of certificate with host mismatch in Apache Log4j SMTP appender. This could allow an SMTPS connection to be intercepted by a man-in-the-middle attack which could leak any log messages sent through that appender.

testcase.name: pkg:maven/log4j/log4j@1.2.17

skipped.message: Log4J SocketServer is not used, so not vulnerable

testcase.system-out: Included in Log4j 1.2 is a SocketServer class that is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted data which can be exploited to remotely execute arbitrary code when combined with a deserialization gadget when listening to untrusted network traffic for log data. This affects Log4j versions up to 1.2 up to 1.2.17.
